com.yelllabs.soapy.helpers
[Groovy] Class Distance

java.lang.Object
  com.yelllabs.soapy.helpers.Distance

class Distance
extends java.lang.Object

A helper class to:

  • get random location within given radius from a place
  • calculate distance between two points in various ways
created:
2012-12-13 jk
updated:
2012-12-13 jk
Authors:
Janusz Kowalczyk (jk)

Method Summary
static double computeDistanceBetween(java.lang.Double lat1, java.lang.Double lon1, java.lang.Double lat2, java.lang.Double lon2, java.lang.String unit)

This function computes the distance in km, miles, or nautical miles between two points on map.
static double computeHaversineDistanceBetween(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)

This uses the 'haversine' formula to calculate the great-circle distance between two points - that is, the shortest distance over the earth's surface - giving an 'as-the-crow-flies' distance between the points (ignoring any hills, of course!).
static double deg2rad(double deg)

This function converts decimal degrees to radians
static java.util.Map getLocInRadius(double lat, double lon, double radius)

Calculate new random location within a given radius (in km )
static java.util.Map getLocInRadius(double lat, double lon, double minDistance, double maxDistance)

Calculate new random location within a given bounded distance (in km )
static double rad2deg(double rad)

This function converts radians to decimal degrees

Method Detail

computeDistanceBetween

static double computeDistanceBetween(java.lang.Double lat1, java.lang.Double lon1, java.lang.Double lat2, java.lang.Double lon2, java.lang.String unit)
This function computes the distance in km, miles, or nautical miles between two points on map.
SOURCE:
http://www.dzone.com/snippets/distance-calculation-using-3
Parameters:
Double - Latitude of the first place
Double - Longitude of the first place
Double - Latitude of the second place
Double - Longitude of the second place
String - unit distance unit: K = Km, M = miles, N = nautical miles
Authors:
ZIPCodeWorld.com
Returns:
Distance between two places in desired distance unit

computeHaversineDistanceBetween

static double computeHaversineDistanceBetween(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)
This uses the 'haversine' formula to calculate the great-circle distance between two points - that is, the shortest distance over the earth's surface - giving an 'as-the-crow-flies' distance between the points (ignoring any hills, of course!).
URL:
http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/latlong.html
Parameters:
double - lat1 Latitude of the first place
double - Longitude of the first place
double - Latitude of the second place
double - Longitude of the second place
Authors:
Chris Veness 2002-2012
Returns:
Disantance between two places in Km

getLocInRadius

static java.util.Map getLocInRadius(double lat, double lon, double radius)
Calculate new random location within a given radius (in km )
SOURCE:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees
Parameters:
double - lat - reference lat point
double - lon - reference lon point
double - radius - radius in km
Returns:
A Map of values: lat, lon, formLat, formLon, where form* are formatted represantations of first values

getLocInRadius

static java.util.Map getLocInRadius(double lat, double lon, double minDistance, double maxDistance)
Calculate new random location within a given bounded distance (in km )
SOURCE:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees
Parameters:
double - lat - reference lat point
double - lon - reference lon point
double - minDistance - min distance in which new random location will be genarated
double - maxDistance - max distance in which new random location will be genarated
Returns:
A Map of values: lat, lon, formLat, formLon, distance. Where formLat/formLon are formatted represantations of the first values and distance is randomly selected distance from given range
